item.name: Docker (Host) Name
item.description: The "Name" value as returned by 'docker info'.

item.name: Docker Containers
item.description: The number of containers returned by 'docker info'

item.name: Docker CPUs
item.description: The "CPUs" value as returned by 'docker info'.

item.name: Docker Daemons Running (CentOS)
item.description: The number of docker process daemons running according to 'ps'

item.name: Docker Daemons Running (Ubuntu)
item.description: The number of docker process daemons running according to 'ps'

item.name: Docker Execution Driver
item.description: The "Execution Driver" value as reported by 'docker info'.

item.name: Docker ID
item.description: The "ID" value as returned by 'docker info'.

item.name: Docker images
item.description: The number of Docker images cached locally according to 'docker info'.

item.name: Docker Kernel Version
item.description: The "Kernel Version" as reported by 'docker info'.

item.name: Docker Logging Driver
item.description: The "Logging Driver" value as reported by 'docker info'.

item.name: Docker Operating System
item.description: The "Operating System" as returned by 'docker info'.

item.name: Docker Storage Driver
item.description: The name of the Docker storage driver as returned by 'docker info'.

item.name: Docker Storage Driver Backing Filesystem
item.description: The "Backing Filesystem" as returned by 'docker info'.

item.name: Docker Storage Driver Data file
item.description: The "Data file" as returned by 'docker info'.

item.name: Docker Storage Driver Data loop file
item.description: The "Data loop file" value as reported by 'docker info'

item.name: Docker Storage Driver Data Space Available
item.description: The "Data Space Available" as returned by 'docker info'.

item.name: Docker Storage Driver Data Space Available Percentage
item.params: last("docker.info.convert[Data Space Available]") / last("docker.info.convert[Data Space Total]") * 100.0
item.description: Calculated value indicating the amount of free space available.

item.name: Docker Storage Driver Data Space Total
item.description: The "Data Space Total" as returned by 'docker info'.

item.name: Docker Storage Driver Data Space Used
item.description: The "Data Space Used" as returned by 'docker info'.

item.name: Docker Storage Driver Deferred Removal Enabled
item.description: The "Deferred Removal Enabled" value as reported by 'docker info'.

item.name: Docker Storage Driver Library Version
item.description: The "Library Version" value as returned by 'docker info'.

item.name: Docker Storage Driver Metadata file
item.description: The "Metadata file" as returned by 'docker info'.

item.name: Docker Storage Driver Metadata loop file
item.description: The "Metadata loop file" value as returned by 'docker info'

item.name: Docker Storage Driver Metadata Space Available
item.description: The "Metadata Space Available" as returned by 'docker info'.

item.name: Docker Storage Driver Metadata Space Available Percentage
item.params: last("docker.info.convert[Metadata Space Available]") / last("docker.info.convert[Metadata Space Total]") * 100.0
item.description: Calculated value indicating the amount of free space available.

item.name: Docker Storage Driver Metadata Space Total
item.description: The "Metadata Space Total" as returned by 'docker info'.

item.name: Docker Storage Driver Metadata Space Used
item.description: The "Metadata Space Used" as returned by 'docker info'.

item.name: Docker Storage Driver Pool Blocksize
item.description: The "Pool Blocksize" as returned by 'docker info'.

item.name: Docker Storage Driver Pool Name
item.description: The "Pool Name" for the storage driver as returned by 'docker info'.

item.name: Docker Storage Driver Udev Sync Supported
item.description: The "Udev Sync Supported" value as reported by 'docker info'

item.name: Docker Total Memory
item.description: The "Total Memory" value as returned by 'docker info'.

item.name: Docker Version
item.description: The Docker version number as returned by 'docker -v'.

item.name: Number of Docker containers running
item.description: This is the number of running containers as returned by the 'docker ps -qa' command.

item.name: Number of Docker containers stopped
item.description: This is calculated from the number of docker containers running subtracted from the number of docker containers through 'docker info'.

item.name: Agent ping
item.description: The agent always returns 1 for this item. It could be used in combination with nodata() for availability check.

item.name: Values processed by Zabbix proxy per second
Values processed by Zabbix server per second
Connectivity Check 1
Connectivity Check 2
Connectivity Check 3
Connectivity Check 4
Connectivity Check 5
Connectivity Check 6
Connectivity Check 7

item_prototype.name: Disk:$1:IO:Currently Active
item_prototype.description: Field #12 Number of I/Os currently in progress. The only field that should go to zero. Incremented as requests are given to appropriate struct request_queue and decremented as they finish.

item_prototype.name: Disk:$1:IO:ms
item_prototype.description: Field #13 Number of milliseconds spent doing I/Os. This field increases so long as field #12 (custom.vfs.dev.io.active) is nonzero.

item_prototype.name: Disk:$1:IO:Weight:ms
item_prototype.description: Field #14 Weighted number of milliseconds spent doing I/Os. This field is incremented at each I/O start, I/O completion, I/O merge, or read of these stats by the number of I/Os in progress (field 12) times the number of milliseconds spent doing I/O since the last update of this field. This can provide an easy measure of both I/O completion time and the backlog that may be accumulating.

item_prototype.name: Disk:$1:Read:Bytes/sec
item_prototype.description: Field #6 This is the total number of sectors read successfully.

item_prototype.name: Disk:$1:Read:Merged
item_prototype.description: Field #5 Number of reads merged. Reads and writes which are adjacent to each other may be merged for efficiency. Thus two 4K reads may become one 8K read before it is ultimately handed to the disk, and so it will be counted (and queued) as only one I/O. This field lets you know how often this was done.

item_prototype.name: Disk:$1:Read:ms
item_prototype.description: Field #7 Number of milliseconds spent reading This is the total number of milliseconds spent by all reads (as measured from __make_request() to end_that_request_last()).

item_prototype.name: Disk:$1:Read:Ops per second
item_prototype.description: Field #4 This is the total number of reads completed successfully.

item_prototype.name: Disk:$1:Write:Bytes/sec
item_prototype.description: Field #10 This is the total number of sectors written successfully.

item_prototype.name: Disk:$1:Write:Merged
item_prototype.description: Field #9 Number of writes merged. Reads and writes which are adjacent to each other may be merged for efficiency. Thus two 4K reads may become one 8K read before it is ultimately handed to the disk, and so it will be counted (and queued) as only one I/O. This field lets you know how often this was done.

item_prototype.name: Disk:$1:Write:ms
item_prototype.description: Field #11 Number of milliseconds spent writing. This is the total number of milliseconds spent by all writes (as measured from __make_request() to end_that_request_last()).

item_prototype.name: Disk:$1:Write:Ops per second
item_prototype.description: Field #8 This is the total number of writes completed successfully.

item.name: comp Accumulated time spent in compilation
comp Name of the current JIT compiler
gc ConcurrentMarkSweep accumulated time spent in collection
gc ConcurrentMarkSweep number of collections per second
gc Copy accumulated time spent in collection
gc Copy number of collections per second
gc MarkSweepCompact accumulated time spent in collection
gc MarkSweepCompact number of collections per second
gc ParNew accumulated time spent in collection
gc ParNew number of collections per second
gc PS MarkSweep accumulated time spent in collection
gc PS MarkSweep number of collections per second
gc PS Scavenge accumulated time spent in collection
gc PS Scavenge number of collections per second

item.name: Available memory
item.description: Available memory is defined as free+cached+buffers memory.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: Amount of time the CPU has been waiting for I/O to complete.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that have been niced.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The amount of CPU 'stolen' from this virtual machine by the hypervisor for other tasks (such as running another virtual machine).

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing software interrupts.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent doing nothing.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing hardware interrupts.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that are not niced.

item.description: System host name.

item.description: Number of users who are currently logged in.

item.name: Number of processes
item.description: Total number of processes in any state.

item.name: Number of running processes
item.description: Number of processes in running state.

item.name: Processor load (1 min average all)
item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load

item.name: Processor load (1 min average per core)
item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: Processor load (5 min average per core)
item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: Processor load (15 min average per core)
item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: System information
item.description: The information as normally returned by 'uname -a'.

template.name: Template Process Linux
template.description:
Note:should add Macros on hosts proc.num[<name>,<user>,<state>,<cmdline>] name - process name (default is “all processes”) user - user name (default is “all users”) state - possible values: all (default), run, sleep, zomb cmdline - filter by command line (it is a regular expression)
